CatDescriptText: Mr. William A. Taylor, 3352 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 2 with question: �What do you think of young men or boys who process their hair? Do you think it improves their appearance or not?� answer reads: �Yes, it improves their appearances.  It makes them look different and better.  I think that it�s a good thing, which has come along.  I have a son and two girls and I like anything which improves their appearances.  My son wears a process.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William A. Taylor, wearing light colored double breasted suit jacket with cigars in breast pocket, plaid button down collared shirt, graphic patterned necktie, and hat, standing in front of large rectangular stone block wall
